title: New: KRAKEN – PARADISE IS HELL
content:
We all know how much Manchester’s MONEY love changing their name and experimenting under differing aliases, having previously released music under the names Meke Menete, Youth and Books.

Given the recent flurry of press attention surrounding them, it’s all the more refreshing to find that lead singer Jamie Lee isn’t resting on his laurels is intent on constantly mixing things up with this new solo project entitled KRAKEN. This new track from Lee features little information, aside from being uploaded via a Youtube account taken from Lee’s tumblr, however the vocals are distinctly similar to those found on previous MONEY tracks, and the lethargic, drawled organ is ever present. Two images flicker every few seconds, changing between an angelic, Virgin Mary statue and an all grey dead screen, the kind you find when there’s a transmission failure or the like.

There’s a melancholic, slightly disgruntled feel to Paradise Is Hell, a poetic number dealing with the looming dishonesty of capitalism and adolescent angst. The comparisons with MONEY are unavoidable however to pigeon hole them both under the same banner would be offensive, with KRAKEN showcasing a slightly more awkward, delicate side to Lee. Ultimately, it may be ever-so introvert, but boy is it beautiful.

‘trains to infinity’
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
